intro: Acrocarpidium exile, commonly known as the slender acrocarp, is a rare and delicate moss species belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its low-growing, creeping habit and narrow, elongated leaves that are typically less than 1 centimeter in width. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest floors or rocky crevices. Its reproductive structures, known as sporophytes, are small and inconspicuous, typical of many mosses. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Acrocarpidium exile is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
